page.title: 13AGRICULTURE IN TRENT VALLEY
page.content: Agriculture in the area is mainly arable. The soils are gravel, loam and Keuper marl. Crops are grown on a rotation basis. the main crops are: 1.{Sugar beet}which is refined into sugar, the waste products being used as cattle feed. 2.{Barley}for brewing locally and export. 3.{Oil seed rape}made into margarine and cooking oil. 4.{Potatoes}for sale locally and the manufacture of potato crisps. {Pigs}are reared and sold for bacon and pork.{Beef cattle}are fattened and sold at Nottingham market to local butchers.{Breeding ewes}are kept and the lambs sold for meat. The average size of farms in the area is 150 acres. As farms become vacant the land is often sold to other farmers, and the farmhouse sold off.
